ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Soloing bards
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree.  I just don t see how our damage shield songs could possible help them do their job better than extra strength or extra haste or extra dex (for crits)
ygData.messageBody:
I agree. I just don't see how our damage shield songs could possible help
them do their job better than extra strength or extra haste or extra dex
(for crits) etc. etc. I just have not heard any convincing arguments for
why our damage songs would ever be the best choice for an additional song to
mix in. Except from a few human monks who desperately wish to be able to
see in the dark.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Amy Pratt [mailto:pratts001@...]
Sent: Tuesday, January 30, 2001 1:26 PM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Soloing bards


There's a problem with that sort of argument, though. If your primary goal
as a bard is to do damage in the group, you're missing out on well over half
of what the class can do that's more effective than adding more damage. I
don't sing dots in a group, I'll leave the serious damage dealing to the
tanks and casters. I'd rather make them more able to do their jobs than try
to do it for them.

Kaelrei


> Uh, Dirkson's point was that adding more money wasn't necessarily a good
> idea just because the amount you were adding was seemingly insignificant.
> Just because you have a free 18 pt damage shield doesn't make the choice
to
> add another 9 pointer on top of it any more sound. If you can do more
> damage another way its' still better than adding that 9 point damage
shield.
>
> Kit
>
> "12 points here, 9 points there, 6 points stacked... pretty soon we are
> talking a pretty nice damage shield!"
>
> Sylly
>
> p.s. was it the Hon. Everrt Dirkson (sp?) senior senator from the great
> state of IL who said:
>
> "A billion dollars here, a billion dollars there, pretty soon we are
talking
> about some serious money..."
>

with the subject submissions.
